messages.content: ComfyUI-Reactor-Node is a fast and simple face swap extension node for ComfyUI, based on the ReActor SD-WebUI face swap extension.
What are the key features of the ReActor Node?
The ReActor Node allows blending several images with persons into one face model file which can be used with 'Load Face Model' Node or in SD WebUI. It also provides face restoration and face indexes.

To install ComfyUI-Reactor-Node for SD WebUI, follow these steps: 1. Close the running SD-WebUI/Comfy Server. 2. Install Visual Studio 2022 (Community version). 3. Go to the 'extensions/sd-webui-comfyui/ComfyUI/custom_nodes' folder. 4. Clone the repository 'git clone https://github.com/Gourieff/comfyui-reactor-node'. 5. Activate the venv and update pip. 6. Install the package using Python. Refer to detailed steps in the 'Installation' section of the documentation.

Connect all required slots and run the query. The inputs include 'input_image', 'source_image', and 'face_model'. The outputs are 'IMAGE' and 'FACE_MODEL'. Find the ReActor Nodes inside the 'ReActor' menu or by searching.
What is the latest update in ComfyUI-Reactor-Node?

As of version 0.4.2 <sub><sup>BETA1</sup></sub>, users can blend several images with persons into one face model file. Connect the ImpactPack's 'Make Image Batch' Node as an input to the ReActor's one and load images you want to blend.
What should I do if I encounter errors while using ReActor Node?
If you encounter any errors, remove the current ReActor node in your workflow and add it again. Updates are frequent and new functions appear; older nodes may work with errors or not work at all.

The pre-trained models 'buffalo_l' and 'inswapper_128.onnx' included in ComfyUI-Reactor-Node are available for non-commercial research purposes only. Users are expected to use these models responsibly and within the conditions of use. If you wish to use this software for commercial purposes, you must train your own models or find models that can be used commercially.
How can I ensure the safety of models downloaded from unverified sources?
You can check hashsums if you download these models from unverified (or untrusted) sources. The safe-to-use models have specific hashsums which you can compare to ensure their safety.
